sourcesContent:
import React from 'react'; import '../../App.css'; import Footer from "../Footer"; import useScrollToTop from '../useScrollToTop'; export default function FineArt() { useScrollToTop(); return ( <>

Fine Art

Summer's Chill

In the summer of 2020, in the midst of the pandemic, I stayed home all day with the air conditioner and reminisced about previous summers, when I traveled to different places and the only way to escape from the unbearable heat was a cool drink.



Medium: Acrylic

Date: 2020

Size: 24in x 30in





Nightmare

Realism in the soft and sharp detailed folds of the blanket is contrasted by the strange otherworldly coloring in the face, blurred at times with the haziness that comes with sleeping, yet also with harsh shadows due to the unpleasant dream. The heavy blankets bound me to my bed. I cannot come to reality— I will never escape the nightmare.



Medium: Acrylic

Date: 2020

Size: 22in x 30in





Dad

I used the side of the charcoal stick and didn't blend to keep texture throughout this piece. This is meant to portray the grief and fatigue of my dad after my Uncle died. It was an intense period of time for me and my family.



Medium: Black Charcoal, Kneaded Eraser

Date: 2023

Size: 18in x 24in





Cityscape

In this futuristic city the ground is terraformed to curve down towards the center emitting light, surrounded by water systems, roads, and buildings. The giant structures might be relics of an ancient time, attraction sites, or something else. Is it humans that live here, a future sentient species, or aliens that have come from another world?



Medium: Acrylic, Oil Based Clay, Oil Pastels

Date: 2021

Size: 20in x 16in





Confucius's Life

This canvas tells the life story of Confucius, starting from his birth in the top left corner and circling counter-clockwise. It includes his journey through youth, adulthood, loss, glory, exile, and death. His teachings and legacy live on, as he rises to heaven.



Medium: Acrylic

Date: 2020

Size: 16in x 20in





Longevity Noodles

In China, noodles are served at birthdays and celebrations. Long Life Noodles are never cut or broken when cooked. The longer the noodles, the longer the life. Red symbolizes good luck and is often worn or used in decorations at special events. Through this painting, I wish my grandmother a long and happy life.



Medium: Acrylic

Date: 2020

Size: 18in x 24in





Dining Room

During Covid I stayed in this space almost every waking hour. Bits and pieces of me are hidden throughout this painting: Chinese decorations, a family photo, art supplies, textbooks, and awards. The lone chair hints at my isolation and the blank window reflects how time is indefinite here. This observational piece captures my distorted perspective.



Medium: Watercolor Pencils, Water

Date: 2020

Size: 24in x 18in





Melancholic Memory

This is a study of a place in my house where I like to sit, read, and gaze out the window. I came up with this piece after thinking of going to college and moving out. The photograph of the model has warm lighting, which is stripped away by the blue tones of the painting, creating a cold, lonely atmosphere. Viewing the space in third person, I assembled the pieces as I would in my own mind.



Medium: Acrylic, Bristol Paper, X-Acto Knife, Glue

Date: 2021

Size: 24in x 18in





Curves

An exploration of Earth and the Universe's curves: from sound waves, to ripples, to mountains, to atoms. In nature, there are typically no perfectly straight lines. I experimented with creating volume from lines. The wire swirl shakes circularly when you touch it.



Medium: Acrylic, Collage, Wire, Black Tape

Date: 2021

Size: 18in x 14in x 7.5in





Discovery

A sunken ship in my dream. The darkness of the sea is lit up by the life of the creatures living in it. A brave explorer ventures deeper, drawn into the circular movement. It almost seems like a portal to another world.



Medium: Ink

Date: 2021

Size: 12in x 9in





In a Week

Inspired by the song “In a Week” by Hozier, I explore time based storytelling through a single image. In death, there is life, and a small bud rises and blooms into a beautiful flower. Little critters are gathered around the skeleton, taking a curious peek in their busy life. The shadow lingers.



Medium: Adobe Photoshop

Date: 2021

Size: 2100px x 1500px





Pressure

Self-portrait. The eyes are of members of my family, the sizes correlates with the amount of pressure. One of my eyes is hidden in darkness—they do not see everything. As the eyes stare at me, I gaze at the viewer. Who is watching you?



Medium: Acrylic, Clay

Date: 2021

Size: 20in x 16in





); }
